column2: Carlyle to buy airfield lighting group ADB Safegate -sources LONDON/FRANKFURT
column3: July 15 Buyout group Carlyle has agreed to buy airfield lighting group ADB Safegate at a valuation of about 900 million euros ($1 billion) including debt
column4: sources familiar with the matter said. ~

column2: GM teams up with Uber to expand Maven programme to Australia SYDNEY
column3: July 15 General Motors Co said on Saturday it was testing its car-sharing operation
column5: in Australia through a pilot programme with ride-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc. ~

column2: Unilever vies with Hormel to buy Reckitt food unit -Sunday Times LONDON
column3: July 15 Anglo-Dutch conglomerate Unilever is vying with U.S. canned meat producer Hormel Foods Corp to buy the foods division of British consumer goods maker Reckitt Benckiser

column2: Romania says any Patriot missile system buy meant to boost defence BUCHAREST
column3: July 15 Romanian military purchases are not intended to put strain on relations with nearby Russia but to strengthen the country's defences
column4: President Klaus Iohannis said on Saturday. ~

column2: U.S. judge postpones decision in bid to block Toshiba memory unit sale A U.S. judge did not reach a decision Friday in Western Digital Corp's bid to temporarily block Toshiba Corp from selling its flash memory business in an $18 billion deal but proposed requiring Toshiba to give Western Digital two weeks' notice before closing. ~U.S. judge postpones decision in bid to block Toshiba memory unit sale A U.S. judge did not reach a decision Friday in Western Digital Corp's bid to temporarily block Toshiba Corp from selling its flash memory business in an $18 billion deal but proposed requiring Toshiba to give Western Digital two weeks' notice before closing. ~UPDATE 2-U.S. judge postpones decision in bid to block Toshiba memory unit sale July 14 A U.S. judge did not reach a decision Friday in Western Digital Corp's bid to temporarily block Toshiba Corp from selling its flash memory business in an $18 billion deal but proposed requiring Toshiba to give Western Digital two weeks' notice before closing. ~
